Package org.apache.lucene.analysis

Class AlixReuseStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer.ReuseStrategy
      • org.apache.lucene.analysis.AlixReuseStrategy
  • public class AlixReuseStrategy
extends org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer.ReuseStrategy

    Reuse strategy of Analyzer.TokenStreamComponents in Alix: no cache for indexation, reuse for query parsing.

    Alix is designed to index real text documents (articles, book chaptersâ€¦). Indexing is multi-threaded, and add documents by blocks (books) IndexWriter.addDocuments(Iterable). Life cycle of TokenStream components is hard to predict, the most robust solution is then to not cache Analyzer.TokenStreamComponents, especially because SAXIndexer needs some advanced indexing features (CachingTokenFilter or a TeeSinkTokenFilter).

    The default behavior of Analyzer with Strings was successfully tested with Field(String, CharSequence, org.apache.lucene.index.IndexableFieldType), but problems came with Field(String, TokenStream, IndexableFieldType). The default caching of components were confused (documents disappears, contract violation TokenStream.reset() and {TokenStream.close()).
